```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(patchwork)
```

```{r}
weather_df = 
  rnoaa::meteo_pull_monitors(
    c("USW00094728", "USW00022534", "USS0023B17S"),
    var = c("PRCP", "TMIN", "TMAX"), 
    date_min = "2021-01-01",
    date_max = "2022-12-31") |>
  mutate(
    name = recode(
      id, 
      USW00094728 = "CentralPark_NY", 
      USW00022534 = "Molokai_HI",
      USS0023B17S = "Waterhole_WA"),
    tmin = tmin / 10,
    tmax = tmax / 10,
    month = lubridate::floor_date(date, unit = "month")) |>
  select(name, id, everything())

weather_df
```


## Remember this plot ...?
```{r}
weather_df |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = tmin, y = tmax)) + 
  geom_point(aes(color = name), alpha = .5)
```

## Labels
```{r}
weather_df |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = tmin, y = tmax)) + 
  geom_point(aes(color = name), alpha = .5) +
  labs(
    title = "Temperature plot",
    x = "Minimum daily temperature (C)",
    y = "Maxiumum daily temperature (C)",
    color = "Location",
    caption = "Data from the rnoaa package"
  )
```

## Scales (x and y scales)
```{r}
weather_df |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = tmin, y = tmax)) + 
  geom_point(aes(color = name), alpha = .5) +
  labs(
    title = "Temperature plot",
    x = "Minimum daily temperature (C)",
    y = "Maxiumum daily temperature (C)",
    color = "Location",
    caption = "Data from the rnoaa package"
  ) +
  scale_x_continuous(
    breaks = c(-15, 0, 15), 
    labels = c("-15ยบ C", "0", "15")
  ) +
  scale_y_continuous(
    trans = "sqrt", 
    position = "right"
  )
```

## Scales (color)
```{r}
weather_df |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = tmin, y = tmax)) + 
  geom_point(aes(color = name), alpha = .5) +
  labs(
    title = "Temperature plot",
    x = "Minimum daily temperature (C)",
    y = "Maxiumum daily temperature (C)",
    color = "Location",
    caption = "Data from the rnoaa package"
  ) +
  scale_color_hue(
    name = "Location",
    h = c(100, 300))
```

Another way:
```{r}
weather_df |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = tmin, y = tmax)) + 
  geom_point(aes(color = name), alpha = .5) +
  labs(
    title = "Temperature plot",
    x = "Minimum daily temperature (C)",
    y = "Maxiumum daily temperature (C)",
    color = "Location",
    caption = "Data from the rnoaa package"
  ) +
  viridis::scale_color_viridis(
    name = "Location", 
    discrete = TRUE
  )
```
